text:
1. Local Maxima. 2. The peak of the second maximum is also lower than its first maximum in the backside.
3. The slope of the function is less than zero, and then becomes more negative than zero again before returning to zero at a point which is the local maximum.
4. The second maximum is lower than the global maximum.
5. The peak of the first maximum is higher than the local maximum.
6. The peak of the first maximum is higher than its backside in the case that it's not an end-point.
